CatDescriptText: Ertie Mae (Peaches) Platt, beautician, 528 Horton Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I can't see where it's any harm for the women to be serving in the armed forces during peace time.  It is good for the morale of those women who want to do so.  It is something for them to do other than to be around and to do only housework."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ertie Mae (Peaches) Platt, wearing dark button down coat with rounded up turned collar and light colored buttons, carrying handbag, standing in front of car, with houses and billboard for Mellow Gold cheese in background
